intro: Dimeria namboodiriana, commonly known as the Namboodiri dimeria, is a rare flowering plant native to the Western Ghats of India. It belongs to the family Capparaceae and is characterized by its small, yellowish flowers and succulent leaves. The plant typically grows in rocky or limestone soils and thrives in semi-arid conditions. It is a perennial shrub that produces small, capsule-like fruits containing numerous seeds. Due to habitat loss and limited distribution, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
